sections.heading: On-device processing
paragraphs: Color sampling happens entirely on your device. Camera previews and selected photos are analyzed only to extract color values and are not transmitted to servers.
All core functionality, including color detection, RGB/HEX calculations, and palette editing, is performed locally. No raw image data leaves your device.

sections.heading: Network usage
paragraphs: Network requests are limited to fetching optional, non-personal supporting data such as color or palette names, informational content, or reference metadata. No personal images, camera frames, or photos are uploaded.
bullets: Network access is not required for core functionality.
You can use the app fully offline by disabling network access at the system level.
You may revoke camera and photo permissions at any time from your device settings.

sections.heading: Data retention
paragraphs: Saved colors and palettes are stored locally on your device and remain there until you delete them.
Clearing app data or uninstalling the app removes all saved colors and palettes. No backups are retained.
